AD_GurLeaderAfterKillingAstarion.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of the Gur, thanks the player for joining her in killing the powerful Vampire Lord Astarion had become.

GurHunterInUndercity.synopsis: The player finds Gur Hunter in the Undercity with his children.Only happens if you killed Cazador and released the prisoners.
GurHunterInUndercity.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book.Astarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Astarion Status - Astarion Stayed Vampire SpawnAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Prisoners Status - Prisoners ReleasedAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Teleport to Gur inside Cazador's Dungeontalk to the gur leaderAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Teleport to Gur Hunter & his kids in the SewersTalk to the Gur Hunter

Spawn_002.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book.Astarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Astarion Status - Astarion Stayed Vampire SpawnAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Prisoners Status - Prisoners ReleasedAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Teleport to Gur inside Cazador's Dungeontalk to the gur leaderAstarion - Act 3 - Gur Follow Up - Teleport to Gur Hunter & his kids in the SewersTalk to the child

PAD_AstarionAfterKillingGur.synopsis: Player helped Astarion Vampire Lord defeat the Gur people in Cazador's Dungeon.Astarion is grateful.

Hunter_001.synopsis: One-liner with a member of Gur Tribe at Cazador's Palace
Hunter_001.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Gur Follow UpApproach the Gur Leader, a dialog will be started.After the dialog ends you can click on any individual Gur.

AD_GurTribeMemberAfterKillingAstarion.synopsis: One of the survived members of the Gur Tribe (not Ulma), thanks the player for joining her in killing Astarion, who had become a powerful Vampire Lord.

GurLeader_0.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_0.text: All that matters now is the future. There are few of us left, but we can rebuild. We can be strong again.

GurLeader_1.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_1.text: To take down Cazador at the peak of his power - an incredible feat.

GurLeader_6.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_6.text: Foolish to let him grow so strong, but incredible nonetheless. You have our thanks.

GurLeader_2.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_2.text: I pray the spawn will stay in the Underdark. We will show no mercy if they return here.

GurLeader_4.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_4.text: It is a tragedy so many had to die, but had they lived they would have caused a thousand more tragedies.

GurLeader_3.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_3.text: You did not choose an easy path, but you chose the correct one.

GurLeader_5.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_5.text: Thousands of spawn, trapped beneath our feet. It is a worrying thought.

AD_GurLeaderAfterKillingAstarion_1.speaker: Ulma
AD_GurLeaderAfterKillingAstarion_1.text: At last, Baldur's Gate is free from the vampires' curse.

AD_GurLeaderAfterKillingAstarion_0.speaker: Ulma
AD_GurLeaderAfterKillingAstarion_0.text: There are still dangers ahead, but our work here is done. Thank you for choosing good over evil.

GurHunterInUndercity_3.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunterInUndercity_3.text: My children. My sweet ones - what have they done to you?

GurHunterInUndercity_1.speaker: Kass
GurHunterInUndercity_1.text: I'm hungry, father. I'm so hungry.

GurHunterInUndercity_10.speaker: Chessa
GurHunterInUndercity_10.text: It hurts, father. The hunger - it never stops.

GurHunterInUndercity_0.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunterInUndercity_0.text: Please - do you know of anything that can be done?

GurHunterInUndercity_4.speaker: Player
GurHunterInUndercity_4.text: Let them feed on animals - it's the best you can do.

GurHunterInUndercity_2.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunterInUndercity_2.text: I've been fighting it but I think you're right. Better that than that they start feeding off humans.

GurHunterInUndercity_7.speaker: Player
GurHunterInUndercity_7.text: I'd put them out of their misery, myself.

GurHunterInUndercity_6.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunterInUndercity_6.text: There has been enough misery. No, we will find some other way.

GurHunterInUndercity_5.speaker: Player
GurHunterInUndercity_5.text: Oh no, you're on your own there.

GurHunterInUndercity_9.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunterInUndercity_9.text: We will find a way. I do not see any, but we will find one.

NoAstarion_1.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_1.text: You! There are spawn flooding out of that dungeon - what possessed you to release them?

NoAstarion_19.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_19.text: You! We ask you to free our children and you unleash thousands of vampire spawn on the Sword Coast?
NoAstarion_19.context: InternalNodeContext: Released Spawns, got quest to kill Cazador

NoAstarion_21.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_21.text: They were innocent - it would've been wrong to kill them.

NoAstarion_60.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_60.text: I understand. Although I wonder how many other innocents will die for your mercy.

NoAstarion_4.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_4.text: They're in the Underdark, they won't bother you.

NoAstarion_8.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_8.text: I pray they will stay there. Although who knows what events this has set in motion.

NoAstarion_110.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_110.text: But you were given an impossible choice. Who's to say what path was right.

NoAstarion_94.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_94.text: We will make it our duty to find the spawn that escaped into the Underdark. Especially our children.

NoAstarion_52.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_52.text: I pray they can resist the urges of their new nature. But we shall see.

NoAstarion_90.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_90.text: As for your pale companion, we will hunt him no longer. Unless he gives us cause to.

NoAstarion_44.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_44.text: You have my people's thanks. There will be dark times ahead for us all, but we will stand with you as best we can.

NoAstarion_24.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_24.text: Cazador's dead, your kids are free - that's what you asked for.

NoAstarion_55.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_55.text: However reluctantly, I cannot fault your logic. You did everything that was asked of you.

NoAstarion_37.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_37.text: You'd prefer I killed your children?

NoAstarion_64.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_64.text: Of course not! I just wish - ... I do not know. I wish this had all passed us by.

NoAstarion_30.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_30.text: Hold there! Didn't expect to see anyone with a pulse coming out of that dungeon.

NoAstarion_116.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_116.text: My name's Ulma, my people are monster hunters. But the vampire Cazador made us his prey.

NoAstarion_63.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_63.text: He attacked us, stole our children, and left our tribe shattered.

NoAstarion_82.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_82.text: The few of us that survived came here looking for revenge. But what do we find instead?
NoAstarion_82.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

NoAstarion_29.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_29.text: A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.

NoAstarion_51.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_51.text: You, who destroyed the vampire lord, but released thousands of his spawn?
NoAstarion_51.context: NodeContext: can't believe you did that

NoAstarion_96.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_96.text: Cazador and his spawn dead. And our children with them.
NoAstarion_96.context: NodeContext: Bitter about the death of their children

NoAstarion_38.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_38.text: We meet again. A pity we had to meet like this.
NoAstarion_38.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion Ascended and we met Gur, but we didn't receive the quest.

NoAstarion_43.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_43.text: You could have stopped Astarion. You could have saved our children. Instead?
NoAstarion_43.context: NodeContext: Next line: "one blood-sucking beast replaced with another."

NoAstarion_112.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_112.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

NoAstarion_107.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_107.text: You don't understand, Astarion needed to do this.

NoAstarion_70.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_70.text: I understand perfectly. I have never seen anything so clearly.

NoAstarion_23.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_23.text: You are as monstrous as him. Perhaps more so, because you choose this path.

NoAstarion_117.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_117.text: You won't win this fight, but you can still walk away with your lives.

NoAstarion_84.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_84.text: There is no walking away from this. There is no hiding from the evil you have unleashed.

NoAstarion_99.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_99.text: Your children were vampire spawn - they were already dead.

NoAstarion_12.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_12.text: Do not use our tragedy to justify your sins!

NoAstarion_26.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_26.text: We will find your vampire and end his blight on this land. But first, we deal with you.

NoAstarion_114.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_114.text: Don't worry, you'll join your children soon.

NoAstarion_47.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_47.text: At last, we see you as the monster you are.

NoAstarion_46.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_46.text: You leave with your work half done? Cazador may be dead, but you would leave thousands of spawn trapped in those cages?

NoAstarion_3.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_3.text: Killing his spawn means killing your children.

NoAstarion_45.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_45.text: Perhaps you were right to leave things as you did. We should finish this ourselves.

NoAstarion_101.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_101.text: Thank you for giving us this choice. For giving us a chance to see them one last time.

NoAstarion_17.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_17.text: I took care of the vampire. I'm sure you can handle his spawn without me.

NoAstarion_88.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_88.text: Very well, we will do what needs to be done.

NoAstarion_28.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_28.text: As for our children... we shall see what can be done.

NoAstarion_32.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_32.text: You deal with it. Surely you can manage that.

NoAstarion_59.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_59.text: We sent you here on a mission of mercy, and what do we find?
NoAstarion_59.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion Ascended, we got the quest to kill Cazador

NoAstarion_79.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_79.text: So, is it true? You killed Cazador and all of his prisoners? Including the children he took from us?
NoAstarion_79.context: InternalNodeContext: Spawns Dead, don't know about Children, met Ulma

NoAstarion_115.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_115.text: If your children were vampire spawn, they were dead long before I got there.

NoAstarion_85.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_85.text: I'm sorry, I didn't know your children were in those cells.

NoAstarion_20.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_20.text: Peace was the best I could give them. I'm sorry I couldn't do more.

NoAstarion_89.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_89.text: Alas, you may be right. You had few choices, all bad.

NoAstarion_56.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_56.text: You did the best you could in an impossible situation. No one could ask for more.

NoAstarion_75.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_75.text: That leaves only the matter of your pale companion.

NoAstarion_81.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_81.text: His sins against us are great. But so too are the deeds you have done today.

NoAstarion_73.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_73.text: Tell Astarion he is free. Never again will he be hunted by my people.

NoAstarion_69.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_69.text: And be clear that he owes it all to you.

NoAstarion_2.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_2.text: Thank you, I only want to live in peace.

NoAstarion_40.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_40.text: I fear none of us will see peace yet. There are still trials ahead.

NoAstarion_66.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_66.text: But you have my people's thanks - when it is time for you to face those trials, we will stand with you.

NoAstarion_14.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_14.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

NoAstarion_65.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_65.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry. I wish I could bring your children back.

NoAstarion_10.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_10.text: You gave them peace. For that, for all you have done, you have our thanks.

NoAstarion_108.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_108.text: I know you face trials ahead. But when it is time, you will not face them alone. We will stand with you as best we can.

NoAstarion_76.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_76.text: We offer no gold, but we do give you a promise.

NoAstarion_53.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_53.text: And I hope I never see any of you again.

NoAstarion_6.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_6.text: I would not be so hasty. You have trials still to face - you may want allies.

NoAstarion_72.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_72.text: If such a time comes, if you need help, we will stand with you.

NoAstarion_50.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_50.text: That was not your choice to make! If nothing else we could have said goodbye.

NoAstarion_15.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_15.text: Our children have been twice taken from us: first by the vampire spawn and now by you. But they will be avenged.

NoAstarion_62.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_62.text: Your children were vampire spawn - they were dead long before I got there.

NoAstarion_106.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_106.text: They were our little ones! If nothing else, we could have said goodbye.

NoAstarion_71.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_71.text: I killed seven thousand monsters today, I can kill a few ungrateful hunters too.

NoAstarion_9.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_9.text: None of us need resort to harsh words. We are still friends here.

NoAstarion_74.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_74.text: We fight against evil wherever we find it. And I find it standing before me now.

NoAstarion_86.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_86.text: I admit, I was not sure I would ever see you again. But you faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.
NoAstarion_86.context: InternalNodeContext: Cazador Ascended, we met Ulma

NoAstarion_7.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_7.text: I cannot say if I'm more impressed by your bravery or your terrible luck to face such a foe.

NoAstarion_34.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_34.text: Let's go with the first one.

NoAstarion_105.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_105.text: A pity such an impressive feat came on the heels of our children's tragedy, but you were not responsible for their deaths.

NoAstarion_13.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_13.text: I'm sorry, but I couldn't save your children.

NoAstarion_33.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_33.text: As are we all but this is the hand fate has dealt. We will carry them in our hearts.

NoAstarion_103.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_103.text: I notice your pale companion's absence, but tell him he need not fear us.

NoAstarion_95.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_95.text: I took care of Cazador, so I assume you'll leave Astarion alone now?

NoAstarion_31.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_31.text: Yes, you can tell your pale companion he has nothing to fear.

NoAstarion_49.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_49.text: With his old master dead and our children at rest, we will pursue him no more.

NoAstarion_57.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_57.text: Unless he gives us reason to.

NoAstarion_100.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_100.text: As for you, you have my people's thanks. I know you face trials ahead - we will stand with you as best we can.

NoAstarion_113.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_113.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

NoAstarion_36.speaker: Player
NoAstarion_36.text: It was nothing, I'm surprised he beat you so badly.

NoAstarion_16.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_16.text: The beast is dead and that is what matters. Our children are avenged, if nothing else.

NoAstarion_98.speaker: Ulma
NoAstarion_98.text: So, is it true? Cazador is dead by your hand, and so are our children?
NoAstarion_98.context: InternalNodeContext: Spawns Dead, knows about children

Hunter_005_0.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_0.text: At least the vampire lord is defeated. Cazador will never steal away another innocent life.

Hunter_005_1.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_1.text: I almost pity the Underdark for what you have released upon it.

Hunter_005_2.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_2.text: You saved the city from one terror. I pray you can do it again.

Hunter_005_3.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_3.text: It was a kindness, what you did. You ended the suffering of thousands of creatures.

Hunter_005_4.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_4.text: I don't know what to think. I wanted to see our children again, but not like this. Never like this.

Hunter_005_5.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_5.text: You should have killed those beasts. It would have been kinder than leaving them to suffer.

Spawn_002_0.speaker: Chessa
Spawn_002_0.text: At least I am not alone. I could not have borne that eternity.

Spawn_002_1.speaker: Chessa
Spawn_002_1.text: Is this my life now? Darkness and hunger?

Spawn_001_0.speaker: Kass
Spawn_001_0.text: Thank you for your mercy. Thank you for everything.

Spawn_001_1.speaker: Kass
Spawn_001_1.text: I did not expect you to free us. But I am grateful.

Hunter_003_0.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_0.text: I pray the spawn stay low. Otherwise who knows what terror they will wreak.

Hunter_003_1.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_1.text: We came all too close to destruction today. I'm glad you were there to stop it.

Hunter_003_2.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_2.text: You killed Cazador, but didn't have the stomach to wipe out his spawn? A great pity.

Hunter_003_3.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_3.text: An entire nest of vampires, wiped out. Today is a good day.

Hunter_003_4.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_4.text: Destroying Cazador Szarr was a blessing on this whole land. You did well.

Hunter_003_5.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_5.text: You let thousands of vampire spawn go free? How many will die because you could not do what needed to be done?

Hunter_004_0.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_0.text: Thousands of vampire spawn on the run. We will be busy, no doubt about it.

Hunter_004_2.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_2.text: Exalted hunter! You will go down in legend after that fight.

Hunter_004_3.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_3.text: What to do with thousands of imprisoned vampire spawn? Target practice, perhaps?

Hunter_004_4.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_4.text: Thank you for all you have done today.

Hunter_004_5.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_5.text: You did not choose the easy path today, but you chose the right one.

Hunter_004_6.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_6.text: Thousands of vampire spawn on the run, our own children among them.

Hunter_004_1.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_1.text: I only pray something of their innocence remains.

Hunter_006_0.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_0.text: Few people can stand against a vampire, let alone one filled with infernal power. You did well.

Hunter_006_1.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_1.text: Today's battle is done, but tomorrow will bring a new fight.

Hunter_006_2.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_2.text: All those spawn locked up down there. I don't know if I should loathe them or pity them.

Hunter_006_3.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_3.text: You stamped out the entire Szarr legacy in one afternoon. A good day's work.

Hunter_006_4.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_4.text: You could have killed them all. You could have ended Szarr's legacy today.

GurHunter_0.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_0.text: At least Cazador Szarr is dust. That is a blessing, if nothing else.

GurHunter_1.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_1.text: It is a terrible thing for a father to bury his children. Doubly so when nothing remains to bury.

GurHunter_2.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_2.text: To know my little ones are just trapped here, in the dark. There is no pain like it.

GurHunter_3.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_3.text: I wish I could have held my little ones one last time. Shared one last smile with Chessa.

GurHunter_4.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_4.text: I do not know if this is more blessing or curse, but it is at least something.

GurHunter_5.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_5.text: I will find my little ones, wherever they are hiding. We will see what can be done.

GurHunter_6.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_6.text: My little ones are locked down there in the dark? Gods, what has that monster done?

Hunter_002_0.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_0.text: If Cazador had become what he intended to be, he could have torn this city apart. Thanks to you, that won't happen.

Hunter_002_1.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_1.text: Although the chances of something else destroying Baldur's Gate seem quite high.

Hunter_002_2.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_2.text: Anyone capable of killing a vampire as powerful as Cazador has my respect. But you are not a true hunter.

Hunter_002_3.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_3.text: Sparing the spawns was an error. Releasing them was an act of madness.

Hunter_002_4.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_4.text: It is good that Cazador's reign is ended. But you should have killed those wretched creatures along with their master.

Hunter_002_5.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_5.text: This lair is cleansed - no trace of Cazador remains. You are a true hunter.

Hunter_002_6.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_6.text: You can leave. We'll make sure nothing remains but dust, and bad memories.

PAD_AstarionAfterKillingGur_1.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionAfterKillingGur_1.text: Hah! Oh that was very, very satisfying. Who better to test these new powers on?

PAD_AstarionAfterKillingGur_0.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AstarionAfterKillingGur_0.text: And who better to be standing by my side than you, who helped me get them?

Hunter_001_0.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_0.text: I'm just surprised you were able to survive, honestly.

Hunter_001_1.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_1.text: If you think those spawn will stay in the Underdark, you're a fool. We'll see them soon, mark my words.

Hunter_001_2.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_2.text: I didn't think anyone could beat the Vampire Ascendant. I've never been happier to be wrong.

Hunter_001_3.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_3.text: At least the spawn can't do any damage from those cells. Let them rot.

Hunter_001_4.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_4.text: I wish I could have seen you do it - killing all those spawn.

AD_GurTribeMemberAfterKillingAstarion_1.speaker: Oliver Quarlic, Cassivora Dophir, Katelyn Lerskin, Godfrey Mordels
AD_GurTribeMemberAfterKillingAstarion_1.text: Finally, Baldur's Gate is free of those bloodsuckers. You made the right choice.

AD_GurTribeMemberAfterKillingAstarion_0.speaker: Oliver Quarlic, Cassivora Dophir, Katelyn Lerskin, Godfrey Mordels
AD_GurTribeMemberAfterKillingAstarion_0.text: The city will face new dangers soon, but at least there's one less threat stalking the night. Thank you.
